description: Onomatopoeic, imitating the sound of pouring or swallowing liquid.

entries.meaning: The sound made when a significant amount of liquid is poured suddenly out of something, such as a jug or bottle.
(informal) The amount of liquid issued when the "glug" sound is heard.
examples: Pour a glug of bleach into the toilet.

verbs.description: glug (third-person singular simple present glugs, present participle glugging, simple past and past participle glugged)

examples: The water glugged down the sink.
He had glugged that glass of wine before she got a chance to introduce herself.
